Key Arguments: The Bill lacks a clear definition of 'false, misleading or deceptive', raising concerns about who determines the truth.
The Bill may lead to government overreach and control over information, akin to totalitarian states.
There is no mention of protecting freedom of religious communication or other diverse opinions.
The Bill appears to have a double standard by exempting news outlets but not other organizations.
Concerns about the Bill being the 'thin edge of the wedge' leading to erosion of free speech.
Notable Quotes: I love the heart behind this Bill. I love that our government wants to protect Australians...
This strikes me as too similar to some totalitarian states that exist in our world right now.
This Bill feels a little too much like the thin edge of the wedge.
